intro: Costus juruanus var. strigosus, commonly known as the hairy costus, is a tropical plant native to South America. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes gingers and related plants. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and large, narrow leaves covered in fine hairs. Its inflorescence consists of clustered, showy flowers with a distinctive, fragrant aroma. It is often grown for its ornamental value and is adapted to warm, humid climates.
